general.author: Marianne Hagmar and Juan Xu and Chengqiong Xie

revisionhistoryelem.comment: 2012-04-04, EPG 13A. 2 New events was included: INITIAL and DATA_USAGE. Added new optional parameters to the existing struct PDN_INFO.
2012-05-11, EPG 2013A. Used 3GPP standard: Release 8, 2009-06

2013-01-10, EPG 13A. Used 3GPP standard: Release 9, 2010-10. Updated GTPV2_CAUSE_CODE values. Removed keyword optional from structs within PDN_INFO and UE_INFO. Renamed INITIAL event to SESSION_INFO. Highest possible value for DURATION is 6777215. Update of the description for PDN_ID, TIME_HOUR, TIME_MINUTE, TIME_SECOND, TIME_MILLISECOND and DURATION.
2013-03-27, EPG 13A. Updated the descriptions for the parameters APN, URI-NAME, and RULE_SPACE.
2013-04-04, EPG 2013B. Using 3GPP TS 29.274 Release 10, 2013-03. Updated GTPv2-C Cause values. Changed the ffv and fiv tags to enable use of CPG and EPG in parallel (margin in number series).
2013-05-14, EPG 2013B. Added 2 new event SESSION_SUSPENSION and SESSION_RESUME for suspend and resume procedure. Added new SUB_CAUSE_CODE value TEID_UNKNOWN. Added new ORIGINATING_NODE value UNKNOWN.
2013-05-17, EPG 13B. Used 3GPP standard: Release 10, 2011-12. Added 2 new event triggers for handover to and from non-3GPP.
2013-07-12, EPG 13B. Remove the TAI struct and instead replace it with its separate parameters; MCC, MNC, and TAC.
2013-11-22, EPG 2013B CP01. Added new SUB_CAUSE_CODE value MEI_IE_MISSING_OR_INVALID. Update the description of IMSI_VALIDATION.
2014-01-15, EPG 2013B CP01. Add 2 new subcause codes BEARER_INCONSISTENCY_BETWEEN_CP_UP_DURING_CP_FAILOVER and RESTORATION_OF_USER_PLANE_RESILIENCE_FAILED for session resilience functionality.

2014-06-02, EPG 2014B CP02. New event added: DOWNLINK_DATA_NOTIFICATION
New event triggers added due to new Downlink Data Notification event/Network triggered service restoration procedure: SERVICE_REQUEST_DUE_TO_DOWNLINK_DATA_RECEIVED SERVICE_RESTORATION_DUE_TO_DOWNLINK_DATA_RECEIVED SERVICE_RESTORATION_DUE_TO_MESSAGE_RECEIVED SERVICE_RESTORATION_BY_TRYING_ANOTHER_MME DOWNLINK_DATA_NOTIFICATION_FAILURE_INDICATION_RECEIVED ERROR_INDICATION_RECEIVED RELOCATION_TO_OTHER_MME_IN_POOL
New sub-cause codes added due to new Downlink Data Notification event/Network triggered service restoration procedure: MME_OR_SGSN_ATTACHED_UE_TO_ANOTHER_SGW CONTEXT_NOT_FOUND_IN_MME_OR_SGSN MME_OR_SGSN_UNABLE_TO_PAGE_UE MME_OR_SGSN_UNABLE_TO_PAGE_UE_DUE_TO_SUSPENSION UE_NOT_RESPONDING MME_OR_SGSN_HAS_DENIED_SERVICE DOWNLINK_DATA_NOTIFICATION_FAILED DOWNLINK_DATA_NOTIFICATION_FAILURE_INDICATION_RECEIVED SERVICE_RESTORATION_SUPERVISION_TIMER_EXPIRED SERVICE_RESTORATION_CLEANOUT_TIMER_EXPIRED MME_HAS_RESTARTED_WHEN_SERVICE_RESTORATION_ENABLED

2014-09-01, EPG 2014B CP02.
New event trigger added: EVENT_INVOKED_BY_MANAGEMENT
New sub-cause codes added: INVOKED_BY_MANAGEMENT

2014-09-05, EPG 2014B CP02.
Updated event triggers from: SERVICE_RESTORATION_BY_TRYING_ANOTHER_MME RELOCATION_TO_OTHER_MME_IN_POOL To: SERVICE_RESTORATION_BY_TRYING_ANOTHER_MME_OR_SGSN RELOCATION_TO_OTHER_MME_OR_SGSN_IN_POOL
Updated sub-cause code from: MME_HAS_RESTARTED_WHEN_SERVICE_RESTORATION_ENABLED To: MME_OR_SGSN_HAS_RESTARTED_WHEN_SERVICE_RESTORATION_ENABLED

2014-10-07, EPG 2014B CP02.
Added event trigger: SERVICE_RESTORATION_DUE_TO_ERROR_INDICATION_RECEIVED

2014-12-12, EPG 2015A.
New specific sub-cause codes added in range less than 700: INVALID_RESPONSE_FROM_MME_OR_SGSN INVALID_RESPONSE_FROM_PGW REJECTION_RESPONSE_FROM_PGW GTP_SEND_FAILURE_TO_PGW REJECTION_RESPONSE_FROM_MME_OR_SGSN UNEXPECTED_S4U_SGSN_FTEID UNEXPECTED_S12_RNC_FTEID MISSING_S4U_SGSN_FTEID MISSING_S12_RNC_FTEID PMIP_ON_S5S8_NOT_SUPPORTED BEARER_LIMIT_EXCEEDED BEARERS_NOT_IN_PDN_CONNECTION DEFAULT_BEARER_MISSING_IN_MESSAGE OPERATION_AND_SCOPE_INDICATION_FLAGS_SET PGW_S5S8_ADDRESS_MISSING UNEXPECTED_S1_ENODEB_FTEID MISSING_S1_ENODEB_FTEID DIRECT_TUNNEL_FLAG_DIFFERENT_FROM_STORED_VALUE USER_PLANE_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_FAILED DEFAULT_BEARER_ALREADY_IN_USE ERROR_INDICATION_ON_DEFAULT_BEARER_FROM_PGW BEARERS_NOT_MATCHING_REQUEST BEARER_ID_ALREADY_IN_USE ALL_BEARERS_IN_EXISTING_PDN_CONNECTION PGW_S5S8_ADDRESS_TEID_ZERO_AND_OPERATION_INDICATION_FLAG_SET MAIN_CAUSE_ACCEPTED_AND_ALL_BEARER_CAUSES_REJECTED MISSING_S5S8U_PGW_FTEID UNEXPECTED_S5S8U_PGW_FTEID GTP_SEND_FAILURE_TO_MME_OR_SGSN
New general IE sub-cause codes added in range greater than or equeal to 700: XXXXXXX_IE_MISSING_OR_INVALID (where XXXXXXXX is the name of the IE)
Moved sub-cause code to dedicated range above 700: MEI_IE_MISSING_OR_INVALID

2015-02-03, EPG 15A.
New sub-cause codes added: SGW_MEMORY_OVERLOAD_PROTECTION

2015-01-26, EPG 2015B
Added event trigger: SERVICE_REQUEST_DUE_TO_SERVICE_AWARE_SMART_PAGING
Added parameter type: DSCP
Added optional parameter to DOWNLINK_DATA_NOTIFICATION: INNER_DSCP

2015-02-12, EPG 2015B.
Split XML file into two files: * Main event XML file (this file) * Cause Code and Sub Cause Code XML file
The new more expressive enum format in CC/SCC XML file is only used for parameters INTERNAL_CAUSE_CODE, GTPV2_CAUSE_CODE, and SUB_CAUSE_CODE, and includes actions to be taken for certain CC/SCC. All other parameters use the old enum format in main event file. This solution have been inherited from SGSN/MME.
Also adjusted some parameter and SCC descriptions according to input from review. Added info about originating function (SGW or PGW) in event comment. Added info about for which function (SGW or PGW) certain parameters/structures are not present, in order to support CPI generation.

2015-02-17, EPG 2015B.
Adjusted some parameter, CC, and SCC descriptions according to input from review by CPI writer.

2015-04-08, EPG 2015B.
Adjusted some parameter, CC, and SCC descriptions according to input from review by CPI editor.

2015-06-02, EPG 2015B CP01.
WP629: Added new trigger PAUSE_CHARGING_DUE_TO_DROPPED_PAYLOAD for BEARER_MODIFICATION.

parametertype.name: RECORD_LENGTH
parametertype.description: Total numer of bytes in this binary

parametertype.name: FILE_FORMAT_VERSION
parametertype.description: The file format version is incremented if there is a change in the file format which impacts the existing structure of an event - changes in file structure that requires updates of the controlling XML schema or new parameters added in the middle of an event.

parametertype.name: FILE_INFORMATION_VERSION
parametertype.description: The file information version is incremented if there is a change in the file information, for example new events or new parameters added in the end of the events.

parametertype.name: TIME_YEAR
parametertype.description: Year

parametertype.name: TIME_MONTH
parametertype.description: Month

parametertype.name: TIME_DAY
parametertype.description: Year

parametertype.name: TIME_HOUR
parametertype.description: UTC timestamp (Hour) at the time when the event was triggered (HH)

parametertype.name: TIME_MINUTE
parametertype.description: UTC timestamp (Minute) at the start of the usage period (MM)

parametertype.name: TIME_SECOND
parametertype.description: UTC timestamp (Second) at the start of the usage period (SS)
parametertype.detaileddescription: The second value 60 indicates a leap second.

parametertype.name: TIME_MILLISECOND
parametertype.description: UTC timestamp (MilliSecond) at the start of the usage period (MSS)

parametertype.name: DURATION
parametertype.description: Duration of the event in milliseconds
parametertype.detaileddescription: Calculated from when the event procedure starts (that is the first request is received/sent) until the event procedure ends (that is the first accept or reject response is sent/received). If the duration of the event exceeds 16777215 ms the value of the DURATION parameter starts counting from 0 again.

parametertype.name: FILE_TERMINATION_CAUSE
parametertype.description: Reason for ending the logging

parametertype.name: RECORD_TYPE
parametertype.description: Record type

parametertype.name: EVENT_ID
parametertype.description: Event identity

enumeration.enum: Dedicated Bearer or second PDP Context Creation

parametertype.name: RAT
parametertype.description: Radio Access Type

parametertype.name: EVENT_RESULT
parametertype.description: Result of the event procedure

parametertype.name: CAUSE_PROTOCOL
parametertype.description: Indicates from which protocol the cause code originates.
parametertype.detaileddescription: The current release only uses GPTV2 and INTERNAL. INTERNAL causes codes are used when no external signalling is involved.

parametertype.name: CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: Provides information regarding the acceptance or rejection of an operation. The other parameter CAUSE_PROTOCOL has to be analyzed to provide the protocol from where a cause code in an event originates.

parametertype.name: BEARER_ID
parametertype.description: EPS Bearer ID. Identifies one of several bearers in a bearer list.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 24.007, chapter 11.2.3.1.5. Used values are 0, 5-15.

parametertype.name: BEARER_QCI
parametertype.description: Provides information on a QoS class identifier for the bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 36.413, chapter 9.2.1.15.

parametertype.name: ARP_PRIORITY_LEVEL
parametertype.description: Provides information on Priority Level of Allocation and Retention Priority for the bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 29.212, chapter 5.3.45.

parametertype.name: ARP_PCI
parametertype.description: Provides information on Pre-emption-Capability of Allocation and Retention Priority for the bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 29.212, chapter 5.3.46.

parametertype.name: ARP_PVI
parametertype.description: Provides information on Pre-emption-Vulnerability of Allocation and Retention Priority for the bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 29.212, chapter 5.3.47.

parametertype.name: BEARER_MBR_UL
parametertype.description: Provides Maximum Bit Rate (kbps) in uplink direction for a GBR bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 36.413, chapter 9.2.1.18-19.

parametertype.name: BEARER_MBR_DL
parametertype.description: Provides Maximum Bit Rate (kbps) in downlink direction for a GBR bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 36.413, chapter 9.2.1.18-19.

parametertype.name: BEARER_GBR_UL
parametertype.description: Provides Guaranteed Bit Rate (kbps) in uplink direction for a GBR bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 36.413, chapter 9.2.1.18-19.

parametertype.name: BEARER_GBR_DL
parametertype.description: Provides Guaranteed Bit Rate (kbps) in downlink direction for a GBR bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.15 and TS 36.413, chapter 9.2.1.18-19.

parametertype.name: BEARER_CAUSE
parametertype.description: Indicates for each bearer in a bearer list whether the bearer handling was successful, and if not, gives information on the reason.
parametertype.detaileddescription: A subset of the values defined in TS 29.274, table 8.4-1. The parameter is not present in PGW DATA_USAGE events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW DATA_USAGE events.

parametertype.name: BEARER_SENT_DL_PACKETS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many packets have been sent by the SGW in the downlink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: BEARER_SENT_DL_BYTES
parametertype.description: Indicates how many bytes have been sent by the SGW in the downlink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: BEARER_RCVD_UL_PACKETS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many packets have been received by the SGW in the uplink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: BEARER_RCVD_UL_BYTES
parametertype.description: Indicates how many bytes have been received by the SGW in the uplink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: BEARER_DROPPED_DL_PACKETS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many packets have been lost in the downlink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: BEARER_DROPPED_UL_PACKETS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many packets have been lost in the uplink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: MCC
parametertype.description: Mobile Country Code. The MCC uniquely identifies the country of domicile of the mobile subscriber.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 24.008, chapter 10.5.1.4. Format is an integer in BCD format: HEX #{mcc1}{mcc2}{mcc3}, where each {mccX} is a 4 bit BCD digit (0-9). #000 = no valid parameter value available. The parameter is not present in PGW DATA_USAGE events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW DATA_USAGE events.

parametertype.name: MNC
parametertype.description: Mobile Network Code. The MNC identifies the home PLMN of the mobile subscriber.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 24.008, chapter 10.5.1.4. Format is an integer in BCD format: HEX #{mnc1}{mnc2}{mnc3}, where each {mncX} is a 4 bit BCD digit (0-9). F is used as filler digit, for example MNC =12 results in HEX#F12. #000 = no valid parameter value available. The parameter is not present in PGW DATA_USAGE events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW DATA_USAGE events.

parametertype.name: IMSI
parametertype.description: International Mobile Subscriber Identity. The IMSI contains information that is commonly used to identify the UE in the CN.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 23.003 chapter 2.2 for the composition, and TS 29.274 chapter 8.3 for the coding. 5-15 digits, TBCD (Telephony Binary Coded Decimal), each digit represented by 4 bits. Padded with '1111' for each unused digit up to a total length of 8 octets/16 digits.

parametertype.name: IMSI_VALIDATION
parametertype.description: Indicates whether the IMSI is authenticated.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Parameter is omitted if IMSI is missing.

parametertype.name: IMEISV
parametertype.description: International Mobile Equipment Identity Software Version
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 23.003 chapter 6.2 and chapter B1. Encoded according to TS 29.060 chapter 7.7.53. Three sets of digits; 8, 6, and 2 digits respectively. TBCD (Telephony Binary Coded Decimal), each digit represented by 4 bits. Padded with '1111' for each unused digit up to a total length of 8 octets/16 digits.

parametertype.name: APN
parametertype.description: Access Point Name. For PGW events, only the APN Network Identifier part of the APN is included.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 23.003 chapter 9.1. Up to 100 octets. The first octet of a label contains length, the following octets contain ASCII characters. This is repeated for all the labels of the APN, for example ab.dce.fg becomes 2ab3dce2fg. The APN parameter is byte-aligned and it is preceded by a length-field. The parameter is not present in PGW DATA_USAGE events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW DATA_USAGE events.

parametertype.name: APN_AMBR_UL
parametertype.description: Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate (kbps) in the uplink direction
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.7 and TS 24.301, chapter 9.9.4.2. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: APN_AMBR_DL
parametertype.description: Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate (kbps) in the downlink direction
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274, chapter 8.7 and TS 24.301, chapter 9.9.4.2. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: IPV4
parametertype.description: IPv4 address
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.22, TS 23.003 chapter 5. Consists of 4 octets

parametertype.name: IPV6
parametertype.description: IPv6 address
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.22, TS 23.003 chapter 5. Consists of 16 octets

parametertype.name: TAC
parametertype.description: Tracking Area Code. Used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area Code.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.21.4. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: ECI
parametertype.description: E-UTRAN Cell Identity. Used to identify cells within a PLMN.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.21.5. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: LAC
parametertype.description: Location Area Code
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.21.1-3. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: RAC
parametertype.description: Routing Area Code
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.21.3. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: CI
parametertype.description: Cell Identity
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.21.1. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: SAC
parametertype.description: Service Area Code
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 chapter 8.21.2. The parameter is not present in PGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW events.

parametertype.name: EVENT_TRIGGER
parametertype.description: Indicates the reason why the event was triggered.

enumeration.enum: Service request due to downlink data received
Service restoration due to downlink data received
Service restoration due to message received
Service restoration by trying another MME or SGSN
Downlink Data Notification Failure Indication received
The associated UE device has been relocated to another MME or SGSN in the pool
Service restoration due to error indication received
Service request due to service aware smart paging
Inform PGW to pause charging since one of the configured thresholds for dropped payload packets or bytes is exceeded

parametertype.name: ORIGINATING_NODE
parametertype.description: The value represents the node type that initiated the event.
parametertype.detaileddescription: The node uses SELF when the event is initiated by the node itself.

parametertype.name: BYTE_HOUR
parametertype.description: UTC Timestamp, Hour. HH

parametertype.name: BYTE_MINUTE
parametertype.description: UTC Timestamp, Minute. MM

parametertype.name: BYTE_SECOND
parametertype.description: UTC Timestamp, Second. SS
parametertype.detaileddescription: The second value 60 indicates a leap second.

parametertype.name: BYTE_UTC_SIGN
parametertype.description: UTC sign. 0 represents +, and 1 represents -

parametertype.name: ERROR_TYPE
parametertype.description: Error type

parametertype.name: CAUSE_OF_HEADER
parametertype.description: Provides reason why a header record is sent in the stream.

parametertype.name: NODE_ID
parametertype.description: Node Identity, defined as an ASCII string
parametertype.detaileddescription: The parameter is byte-aligned and it is preceded by a length-field.

parametertype.name: NUMBER_OF_DROPPED_EVENTS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many events have been lost during a period of streaming error.

parametertype.name: INTERNAL_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: Provides information about the result of an internally triggered operation. This information is used when CAUSE_PROTOCOL value is set to INTERNAL.

parametertype.name: GTPV2_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: Provides information about the reason for acceptance or rejection of a request message. This information is used when CAUSE_PROTOCOL value is set to GTPV2.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 29.274 table 8.4-1.

parametertype.name: SUB_CAUSE_CODE
parametertype.description: Provides information about detailed reason for failure. This information has to be analyzed together with the CAUSE_CODE parameter and the CAUSE_PROTOCOL parameter.

parametertype.name: PDN_ID
parametertype.description: The PDN identifier is based on the Charging ID.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 32.251. The parameter is not present in SGW events, hence 'optional flag' is set for SGW events.

parametertype.name: SERVICE_UL_BYTES
parametertype.description: Indicates how many bytes have been forwarded by the EPG in the uplink direction for the service.

parametertype.name: SERVICE_DL_BYTES
parametertype.description: Indicates how many bytes have been forwarded by the EPG in the downlink direction for the service.

parametertype.name: BEARER_UL_BYTES
parametertype.description: Indicates how many bytes have been forwarded by the EPG in the uplink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: BEARER_DL_BYTES
parametertype.description: Indicates how many bytes have been forwarded by the EPG in the downlink direction for the bearer.

parametertype.name: BEARER_UL_PACKETS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many packets have been forwarded by the EPG in the uplink direction for the bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: The parameter is not yet supported in PGW DATA_USAGE events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW DATA_USAGE events. To be suppored in later release.

parametertype.name: BEARER_DL_PACKETS
parametertype.description: Indicates how many packets have been forwarded by the EPG in the downlink direction for the bearer.
parametertype.detaileddescription: The parameter is not yet supported in PGW DATA_USAGE events, hence 'optional flag' is set for PGW DATA_USAGE events. To be suppored in later release.

parametertype.name: RATING_GROUP
parametertype.description: Rating Group identifier.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 23.203.

parametertype.name: SERVICE_IDENTIFIER
parametertype.description: Service Identifier.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in TS 23.203.

parametertype.name: URI_ID
parametertype.description: Numerical Uniform Resource Identifier.

parametertype.name: URI_NAME
parametertype.description: Textual Uniform Resource Identifier, defined as an ASCII string.
parametertype.detaileddescription: Defined in RFC 1630. The parameter is byte-aligned and it is preceded by a length-field.

parametertype.name: RULE_SPACE
parametertype.description: Rule Space name, defined as an ASCII string.
parametertype.detaileddescription: The parameter is byte-aligned and it is preceded by a length-field. The parameter is only present in PGW SESSION_INFO events, hence 'optional flag' is set for other event types.

parametertype.name: DSCP
parametertype.description: Provides information on the inner Differentiated Services Code Point (DSCP) value of the IP header for an inspected downlink packet

event.name: SESSION_DELETION
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when a session is deleted.

event.name: BEARER_DELETION
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when dedicated bearers or secondary PDP contexts are deleted.

event.name: SESSION_CREATION
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when a session is created.

event.name: BEARER_CREATION
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when dedicated bearers or secondary PDP contexts are created.

event.name: BEARER_MODIFICATION
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when bearers are modified.

event.name: BEARER_UPDATE
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when the bearers are updated.

event.name: SESSION_INFO
event.comment: PGW event. Provides information when a session is monitored.

event.name: DATA_USAGE
event.comment: PGW event. Provides data usage information.

event.name: SESSION_SUSPENSION
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when a session is suspended.

event.name: SESSION_RESUME
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information when a session is explicitly resumed.

event.name: DOWNLINK_DATA_NOTIFICATION
event.comment: SGW event. Provides information about Downlink Data Notification (DDN), including DDN failures.
